definition: to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to draw back the corners of one's mouth

sentences.english: He winced as she stood on his injured foot .
sentences.chinese: 她踩着他受伤的脚，他疼得龇牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: His face was set in a rictus of death that was somewhat like a smile.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸摆出死亡的龇牙咧嘴，有点像在微笑。

sentences.english: He winced as a sharp pain shot through his left leg.
sentences.chinese: 他左腿一阵剧痛疼得他直龇牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: If you cannot bite never shou your teeth.
sentences.chinese: 不会咬人，切莫龇牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: He looks fierce by showing his teeth to scare children.
sentences.chinese: 他总是龇牙咧嘴吓唬小孩。

sentences.english: He winced as the dog nipped his ankle.
sentences.chinese: 狗咬了他的脚腕子，疼得他龇牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: Self-expansion, show its teeth, insufferably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 自我膨胀，龇牙咧嘴，不可一世。

sentences.english: The bandit bared his teeth in an insolent smile.
sentences.chinese: 那匪徒龇牙咧嘴地狞笑。

definition: to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
